intro: Scleria retroserrata, commonly known as the backward-serrated sedges, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, three-lobed flowers, typically green or brown in color. Scleria retroserrata is often found in wetland environments and is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
